meanings.sent1: The repassing river flowed gently through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The repassing car left a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent3: The repassing clouds seemed to be playing tag with the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her repassing thoughts circled like a flock of birds in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The repassing melody echoed in his ears long after the music had stopped.

meanings.definition: To pass or go through again
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed repassing the same scenic route on her morning walks.
meanings.sent2: The hiker decided to repass the challenging trail for a second time.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept repassing the same spot on the fence, trying to catch a glimpse of the birds.
meanings.sent4: The memories of their laughter repassed through his mind like a film reel.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers repassing through the garden filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: The act of passing or going through again
meanings.sent1: The repassing of the train through the tunnel created a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent2: His repassing of the same story to different friends led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The repassing of the seasons brought familiar sights and sounds.
meanings.sent4: The repassing of time seemed to quicken as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The repassing of the comet through the night sky was a rare sight to behold.
